item.title: An Open Letter to Greenville County Council
item.description: In the twenty years since my family came to Greenville county, I have enjoyed watching it evolve into a bona fide jewel in the crown of the South. Its tale is a compelling one of civic progress punctuated by personal, family, and community success celebrated by many folks from Simpsonville to Slater-Marietta. Many. But not enough. The so-called Family Values Resolution of 1996 stands as a pitiful stain on this story, and itâ€™s past time we as a community retracted it in full.

item.title: Proud to Be
item.description: img[src$="cntr"] { display:block; margin: 0 auto; } Human Being Human It is our privilege and burden to struggle toward understanding. As soon as we think we have it, we find holes in the bottoms of its pockets and we go further looking for the key we are sure was just there. Scraping, scrounging. On Duval Street, there are candles rocking in the evening breeze: golden cat’s eyes twinkle and sway.
